Fields.DialogueText: All right, show me what you've learned.
I think I'm getting the hang of this. Ahem...
When I was a child / My favorite game was Salvo / Now I'm a captain / But no board game could have / taught / These new rules of engagement
It's... certainly 31 syllables...
I know that look.
Perhaps it's the way you approach these things, Kanchou. You're a natural at form. But finding the right word isn't just about adding the numbers up.

Fields.MenuText: I guess that part of it comes easier to me.
How did you learn this?
I just can't find the words.

Fields.DialogueText: Sometimes that's the case! I will try to be more patient.
You're not going to like my answer. It's always been...innate for me, since first I awoke.
Just wait, Kanchou. They will come to you...often when you've stopped looking.
There's a kind of... obliquity in poetry, isn't there?
I wouldn't say that. You're not trying to misdirect the reader. The goal is to take what's familiar and use it to say something new.
I'm trying to do that with the board game angle.
So double down on that. I wrote a haiku once entirely in shogi notation, and-
*ALARM*
I swear they listen in.
All right, lesson over. In sum, it's not just what you say, it's how you say it. To battle!
@BATTLE
A special dispatch for you, Hiryū. From Tokyo.
Arigatō! I've been waiting for... oh.
What's wrong, Hiryū? You look like you've listened to my poetry.
First of all, such self-deprecation does not become you.
I'll take it under advisement.
As for myself, well... just look.
That's about Khalkhin Gol. Sorry, Nomonhan.
Different names for the same thing. I wanted to know the whole story, and it... it seems it was nothing but slaughter up there.

Fields.MenuText: That bad?
That's not our business.
Is there something the Belles can say about it?

Fields.DialogueText: It seems we overreached, and the Soviets took advantage. I don't know where we'd be if the Morganas hadn't come to distract us all.
We Kami are divine servants of the Emperor. That makes it our business, no matter where we are.
Not without risk. The Army control the media. We would be blamed for stirring up dissent, no matter how right we were.
There's only so much we can do about it here. Right now I'd say we're fighting a bigger fight.
Easy for either of us to say. This is the reason I exist.
And I-
-Am along for the ride.
Very funny. Someone's got to drive you.
Helmsman.
You're right. I'm just here to write poetry and look pretty.
*ALARM*
You certainly write. We'll make poetry of it when the battle is won!
It's how you say it, eh?
@BATTLE
I'll show you mine if you show me yours. It's only fair!
I'll let that slide without comment.
Or don't, as long as it rhymes!
Do you have time to give this a once-over?
I'm sensing a Morgana, Kanchou. It will have to wait!
The alarm hasn't gone off. Our poems are short.
We can wring hours out of five simple lines. Wouldn't you rather we be uninterrupted?
@BATTLE
Sailors, rejoice! You are true credits to the Empire.

Fields.MenuText: They'll be talking about that one for weeks.
Well done. Got a moment?
Not to Zurich?

Fields.DialogueText: My sword is not just for show, Kanchou, even at sea!
Your work has been at the back of my mind all day. Let's bring it forward.
Now that we've got a spare moment, I was hoping to hear one of your works.
Don't tease me and then turn it around! You asked to show one of your poems.
What can I say? Your performance today was inspiring. Maybe I want an encore.
Even if the League of Nations were useful men would not carry its banner into battle. Countries are more inspiring than organizations.
Are we rhyming now? Maybe we should try sonnets.
A worthy idea. Like tanka, they are famous for being exchanged by lovers...did you know that?
All the more reason.
Indeed...
Hiryū, I was thinking... oh. Um... is now a bad time?
The only time. Kanchou... this is unconscionable.
A destroyer... took on a Morgana group alone?
A sleeping destroyer. Without a Kami.

Fields.MenuText: How did they do?
Were there any survivors?
What!? Who authorized that?

Fields.DialogueText: Nobody. The kanchou's second in command mutinied and led the charge.
None. One of my sisters' observer planes caught pictures of it.
As well as you'd expect.
What a waste.
Worse than a waste. It is materiel and personnel that witch may use as she sees fit.
We'll postpone the reading. We should be on guard.
No! Show me. I... I need to calm down.
All right. Let's see...
Upon deep waters / Thousands of swimmers / Racing to bleed last
Kanchou... that form...
You have to know the rules to--
Why swimmers?
Well, that's an interesting one. You see--
*ALARM*
Their sins continue to mount. So shall our victories!
@BATTLE
Did I surprise you?
Well done, Kanchou. You're tapping into some powerful imagery.
Thank you. If you've got time...I'd like to treat you to a sonnet as well.
*ALARM*
You have given me something else to fight for!
@BATTLE
...With breath of smoke and steam, on wings of steel.
My, Kanchou... you certainly know how to paint a picture.
Turns out all I needed was more words.
The sonnet form has its perks, I will grant you. But you can do so much more with less.

Fields.MenuText: Let's see you try.
We've all got our preferences.
You can do more with more, too.

Fields.DialogueText: As a matter of fact, I have something especially for you!
That is what makes discussing them so exciting!
Efficiency, Kanchou! Half a battle is mastering it.
Now, then...
By the Emperor's will / The seas shall bow before me / And along the way / If I should find a lover / Then that too is his decree.
You really can do more with less.
Hai. In fact, I am not finished.
Something tells me you won't be for a while.
Allow me to demonstrate.
Whoa!
Keep up, Kanchou! Do not think I will go easy on you.
If anything, I'd expect you to be harder on me!
That burning in your muscles... is it passion or strength?
Both!
Aah!
Well, that looks like the round.
There was a time when kendō did not agree with you. You've improved!

Fields.MenuText: The faster our sessions end, the faster we can get out of the engine room. I'm roasting.
You don't let up for a minute. It's hard not to.
You sure you didn't let me win?

Fields.DialogueText: A little incentive goes a long way. Duress can sharpen the focus.
I'm glad you view defeat as an opportunity. There are many who would be frustrated.
My pride will not allow it!
*ALARM*
Damn! I thought the forecast called for clear waters.
Race you to the bridge?
Half-dressed?
I'll give you a head start!
Says the one who can phase through her bulkheads...
@BATTLE
Hiryū, do you see that? What's she doing?
Flags... it looks like she's... signaling? She wants to talk?
Morganas do diplomacy?
Wait...what could that possibly-
Hiryū?
Grr...Scramble the Zeros. We answer in fire.
@BATTLE
What was she saying?
It's not what was said, Kanchou. It's the way she said it. She was using Japanese semaphore.

Fields.MenuText: She wanted to talk specifically to you?
I don't see the connection.
Where'd she learn that?

Fields.DialogueText: You should have looked more closely at the flagman.
She was using one of our people.
From the sleeping destroyer.
One of ours...
With flags lashed to his arms, or growing from them... somehow. I couldn't tell. I'm glad I couldn't.
She didn't want to say anything at all. It was one big boast.
We will never give her a reason, Kanchou. This I vow.
And so do I. It takes every one of us.
You especially.
Sailor, arms up! That shell won't carry itself!
What's all the commotion? Everyone's so... focused.
Sumimasen, Kanchou. I am supervising the crew a little more closely today.
This doesn't have anything to do with--
--That enslaved sailor? It does. I am reminding the crew of their place aboard me. Have you checked up on your subordinates?

Fields.MenuText: I talked to them. They're good sailors.
I don't think that's necessary.
You're being a little paranoid.

Fields.DialogueText: Keep an eye on them. I'm sure that's what the sleeping destroyer's kanchou thought.
Perhaps not. You must win over the crew before mounting a coup, after all...
Kanchou, I am being cautious!
You're starting to scare people. You're intense, but not like this.
As my kanchou, I suppose you--
Captain, nothing. From my heart to yours, please... relax.
*ALARM*
Perhaps I will, Kanchou, but not at this time. There is a demon to slay.
It's a start...
@BATTLE
Hai! You! I see you letting it fall!
You wanted to see me, Kanchou?
I thought we could use a talk. That, and...
Jazz? Forgive me, but I haven't the time for frivolity. The threat to the Empire-
Whatever you want, Kanchou, it will have to wait! I am not letting this one escape.
I don't doubt it. Just report to my quarters after the smoke clears.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: -Was swiftly and brutally dealt with by its most capable daughter.
-Can wait for three minutes.
Your nose twitches when you lie. Have you noticed?

Fields.DialogueText: ...Thank you. She was limping and smoking rather a lot when we drove her off...
I will be keeping time.
...I see your point. It seems I cannot control everything.
Now, Sinatra hasn't even released this one yet. The Harry James Orchestra gave it to Zurich to support us. You lead.
I must say, this sounds...
Relaxing?
Wait... hold on, I... okay, that is 4/4 time. Begin.
"From the Bottom of My Heart." That's what it's called.
It's sentimental. Obvious.
Is this a dance or a poetry lesson?
It certainly reminds me of your earlier offerings.
Well, if that's-
Don't take that tone. That's why I like it. It may be simple, but it's extremely well crafted. It shows promise... it's sincere.
Thank you, Kanchou. I needed this.
Any time.
What's the news from the mainland?
The Soviets haven't reinvaded Manchukuo. I suppose that's something to celebrate. Chestnuts?
Thank you.
Prince Hiroyasu spoke on the sleeping destroyer as well.
The Marshal Admiral? What'd he have to say?
Anyone taking unilateral action against the Funayūrei will be considered a traitor.

Fields.MenuText: That's a good sign.
Even if they're a very capable Belle?
Hang on. Is the Asahi Shimbun calling them "Funayūrei" in print now?

Fields.DialogueText: Enough sailors do, after all. It seems to have stuck.
Especially if they're a very capable Belle. It makes me... torn.
We will have to see.
What's the problem, then?
One... interpretation of how we came to be in Manchukuo in the first place. A handful of officers starts a war nobody else can stop, and things spiral from there.
You're worried that someone will just step up and act.
What if it is one of my sisters, Kanchou? I would sail through fire for any one of them... I cannot bear to think of turning my guns on them.
Don't. Whatever happens, you'll be able do what's right.
But what if I-
You will. You don't have to believe it now. What matters is what you do under pressure. That's where you really shine.
*ALARM*
Shall I prove it?
I'd be delighted.
@BATTLE
...Who put Sinatra on the PA?
My idea, Kanchou. I thought it if soothed me, the crew might feel similarly.
Was that before or after you had the idea?
Ex post facto, I admit. May we keep it on?
I don't see why not. Odd music for a battle, though...
@BATTLE
Full starboard! We can't let this one escape. We...
Did you see the crew cheer?

Fields.MenuText: Amazing work, Hiryū. Musical, even.
It's certainly good for morale, but that was one in a million.
That was reckless...but effective.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō! Once I had the rhythm down...
You underestimate my sense of rhythm!
I think you are starting to rub off on me, Kanchou!
That'll be a fun one for the papers. "Belle Gunfire Keeps Time With Crooner..."
A little showmanship works wonders for morale, Kanchou. I try to fight as if posing for a - KANCHOU!
Got you! Are you all right?
Hai, I only tripped... on these chestnut shells... and I only share them with...
I swear your hair ornaments just unsheathed.
I think I have lectured the crew enough lately. You could do with some hygeine lessons.
Is that the mail ship?
Strange. It's earlier than HQ said it might be. Well, all the better.
Shopping?
For you! A recording from a certain Frank is on its way... tonight, I thought we could-
Do you hear that?
...That... sounds like his voice. But it's different. The pitch is all...
Kanchou, get down!
@BATTLE
Are you all right?

Fields.MenuText: Are you?
The usual ringing in my ears, but I'll be fine.
Never mind me. What was that?

Fields.DialogueText: We won. That's what matters.
I... I never imagined this...
Something only a Funayūrei could conceive of.
That mail ship must have been intercepted. I thought they had escorts...
This isn't right.
It's low. But we'll get them back.
...I don't suppose you'd still-
Perhaps another time, Kanchou. I'm not in a dancing mood after all.
What are you doing with that mailbag?
A bit of screening.

Fields.MenuText: You think there's a security risk?
On whose authority?
Put that down. That's for the crew, not you.

Fields.DialogueText: If the enemy can get her hands on a mail ship, she can get her hands on its mail.
On mine as a Kami in the fight against the Funayūrei.
The crew are me, Kanchou. If some Funayūrei has doctored these I need to protect them.
There you go again. She's not even been sighted in these waters for the past-
By human instruments, Kanchou! Human senses! A superhuman threat needs a superhuman equal.
What could they possibly-
-No. Doubtless you've got an answer already.
*ALARM*
Saved by a Morgana. I definitely didn't see that one coming.
This isn't over, Kanchou. I will not allow her to get one over on us again!
Something tells me she already has...
@BATTLE
Hiryū, stay up here. I don't think anybody's sabotaged the planes.
That is the whole point of sabotage! If I could leave my hull I'd fly one myself.
If they have, you know what to do.
Shoot them down with an explosive round to the gas tank. I discussed the possibility with the pilots just this morning.
So that's why they looked so haunted...
@BATTLE
We need to talk, Hiryū.
Kanchou, our victory was incomplete. We have only ever been able to drive them off, but-
That's not what I mean. You've been great in battle. Stellar, even. But you're scaring the crew. You're scaring me.
I realize that, Kanchou...but this is the only way I feel safe right now.

Fields.MenuText: You're an aircraft carrier. There's nowhere safer than you.
You're playing right into Paranoia's hands.
You're scared. I can tell.

Fields.DialogueText: There is no fear in the ranks of the Imperial Navy!
That's what she wants you to think!
The bigger the beast, the more crippling its weakness!
You're stronger than this. I know you are.
I've worked hard to become so. But there is always more to be done. You humans can only-
We humans will have to do.
Kanchou... wait, Kanchou!
Half ahead. We're entering her range.
Something the matter?
No.
@BATTLE
Kanchou-
Status report, Hiryū.
No casualties, Kanchou, and we're in top form. Please, we need to-

Fields.MenuText: I'm not mad at you, Hiryū.
...One hour. That's all I ask. Then come find me.
We need to continue this conversation later.

Fields.DialogueText: You're... you're not?
You're... not mad?
Why not now?
I could tell the other day I wasn't getting through to you. I'm working on something that might.
What... is it?
Secret. Teach the crew kendō or something while I finish.
Kashikomarimashita.
... Kanchou, I-
Later.
Almost... gah!
The round is mine, Kanchou. Are you all right?
... If she shows her face...
Nani? If who...?
Beat me and I'll tell you the next line.
Next line of... Kanchou! Have you been writing poetry all this time?
Come at me and you might find out!
*ALARM*
What a shame. I suppose we'll have to table this.
Grr... I'll get to the bottom of this!
@BATTLE
What's this about, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Keeping you on your toes, of course.
Getting my beloved back.
You'll find out when you finish the poem.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I bet you haven't even finished it! Clever, Kanchou, very clever!
I... Kanchou, I don't know what to say.
I am the picture of vigilance!
The Morganas are using uncertainty against us. Against you. They know they can't beat you at sea. They're taking the battlefield to your head.
"...If you know neither the enemy nor yourself, you will succumb in every battle..."
Do you understand now?
Sumimasen, Kanchou. I was doubting myself, and you... that could have gotten us all killed. Imagine if I'd felt we had no choice but to...
Perhaps that's what the sleeping destroyer's crew thought.
Their actions may not have made sense... perhaps the rest of the world did not, as well.
So here's a safe mystery for you. Solve it by doing what you do best: fighting. At the end of it you get a reward... to the extent that my poetry is one.
It's worth fighting for. May I give you a reward of my own for beating me?
On the cheek.
What's this spread, Hiryū?
Ah, there you are, Kanchou! I'm putting together a traditional ichiju-sansai for the crew.
I never imagined you as the cooking type.
I am a warship and an onna-bugeisha, but war is not my only purpose. There is no battle on an empty stomach!
I even brought out the sake I save for our assignations.

Fields.MenuText: You're not worried it's poisoned?
Assignations, you say?
Good idea. It's a special occasion.

Fields.DialogueText: Very funny! I can tell, Kanchou, even if poison does not affect me.
You are a writer, Kanchou. Bask in the connotations.
We will have a toast to our perseverance in the face of uncertainty!
In truth, I mean this as an apology as well. For not trusting the crew to live up to my standards. For not trusting you.
I know you mean well, Hiryū. I never doubted you for an instant.
You never had a reason to, Kanchou. I chose you, and not even the Emperor could counsel otherwise.
It's not just that you're a Belle. It's because you're you. I wouldn't have fallen for you otherwise.
Kanchou...
That cup's overflowing.
Gah! I'll clean it up right-
*ALARM*
Leave it. I'll sit there.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, you're going to want to see this.
Have we caught up to the distress signal?
It's just as I dreaded.
Is that-
-A derelict? Hai. I thought the names sounded familiar.
Familiar?
It is the very voice that we heard from the sleeping destroyer. She's taunting us.

Fields.MenuText: Can I trust you to trust us?
It's a lie, Hiryū. That's all the Morganas know how to do.
Is the sailor...

Fields.DialogueText: It may sound like them, but it is not.
What good fortune that my planes can only tell truth!
Like you were this sword.
Wait. Do you hear that?
Hear what, Kanchou?...Oh.
Sinatra. Now I know she's talking to us.
Time we talked back.
@BATTLE
Reading the transcripts?
Not to excess. Could you fetch some more tea?
Somehow I don't believe you.
Black, if you wouldn't mind.
You've been up here for hours.
No milk or sugar.
You've even color-coded-
Kanchou, it's so frustrating! If I find a discernable pattern I can counsel our radio personnel against it, but...

Fields.MenuText: You could use a break.
There isn't one.
Maybe you need chamomile.

Fields.DialogueText: If I go without caffeine now I might capsize.
How do you know that?
Not until I solve this mystery! This is for our safety!
...I actually read through them as well.
So I'm not the only one! There for a moment I was getting worried...
Sometimes I get curious too. But it's not an obsession. I try and live in the moment.
It also explains the chestnut crumbs.
In my defense, those are delicious and you knew that when you supplied them.
Kanchou, I am writing to Admiral Arima at the Central League of the Spiritual Mobilization Movement about this ship's hygeine woes and I am mentioning you by name.
Be sure to mention my battle prowess as well. We're about to give him something to read...
@BATTLE
Kanchou, the Funayūrei are within signaling range!
Grr...Where did - Kanchou! Get away at once!
@BATTLE
What in the world were you thinking!?

Fields.MenuText: I was thinking our signalman could use a break.
That spelling obscenities in semaphore would be hilarious.
I was never in any danger. They have a sense of humor.

Fields.DialogueText: I cannot blame him... you are his superior, even if you are incredibly impulsive!
I appreciate the irony, if only grudgingly.
How can you say that!? This is a war!
I fixed uncertainty for you. I thought we'd move on to surprise.
That's no excuse to endanger yourself. What kind of example do you think that sets for the crew? If you'd been killed, or worse, captured...
You'd do what you needed to.
Kanchou...
Because I'd do the same for you.
Once upon a time that would have been the easiest decision in the world for me. I chose you as my kanchou, but you are not one of my sisters. And yet...
And yet?
You are something more. And that makes things...complicated.
Hiryū...
Sumimasen. I must think on this.
Live steel for this spar, Kanchou. Are you ready?
Let's see how good a teacher you are.
Hah!
Whoa!
Kyaaaaaah!

Fields.MenuText: [Play it safe.]
[Press the attack.]
[Fight dirty.]

Fields.DialogueText: Fight me, Kanchou! Fight me like you'd fight the Morganas!
Bold...but I am bolder!
Heh...you have to know the rules...to break them!
Take this!
Aaaah!
Hiryū! You-
Do not worry, Kanchou. I'm fine.
But... but I stabbed you right through-
Belle, remember? We may choose to be incorporeal. It seems I've managed to surprise you. But I surprised myself as well...quite pleasantly.
With a sword through your heart?
You are capable of seeing me as an enemy... a target... even though we are as close as two people can be.
If, gods forbid, I am on the verge of capture... I would need you to scuttle me. You can, even if you doubt yourself.
You Belles have a really interesting way of seeing the world, you know that?
War brought us into this world. War can take us out. Who's to say it cannot bring us back? And that's not even getting into the Shinto implications...
*ALARM*
Hadn't you better remove your sword from my torso?
Oh! Right.
@BATTLE
You're looking chipper.
I am! I've just gotten a response from Admiral Arima.

Fields.MenuText: You tell him about the chestnuts?
That's amazing! He's a busy man.
Did you tell him about...us?

Fields.DialogueText: Not in the detail I threatened to. You're off the hook.
He runs the Meiji Shrine these days. What I'd give to go there myself...
I didn't think it prudent. The world will accept it...in time.
Well, don't keep me waiting! What's it say?
"How the world has changed since my cadet days. I should like to have heard the Tsukuba speak, doubtless with a British accent left from her days as the HMS Malacca..."
Are you... vibrating?
It's not every day one of your idols writes you! Oh, he wants me to report on our morale initiatives! This could be the beginning of a correspondence...
I'm happy for you, Hiryū.
Now all we need is to introduce you to that Sinatra fellow!
I think that'd be a bit more difficult.
One never knows until they try, Kanchou. Just look at us! Imagine if one of us had rejected the other...
I can't, and I won't. Just like if you should have to be scuttled.
Doing what's right in the moment. I understand, Kanchou. This feels right to me.
Here comes a Morgana. Aren't they just the worst company...
@BATTLE
Bokken this time?
I made my point with the steels. Wood will suffice for our training.
You've still got that poem to wring out of me, remember?
I never forgot.
*ALARM*
And back above we go.
The suspense hurts more than her guns...
@BATTLE
I ought to have earned a line for getting to the bridge first.
You beat me in this round. A promise is a promise.
If she shows her face / She should fear no evil thing / Nor the march of time / For...
For...?

Fields.MenuText: Almost let it slip.
I'll give you the rest for a sword through the heart.
What do you think so far?

Fields.DialogueText: It's not finished yet. I don't know.
Do not joke about that, Kanchou! You are only human. Besides, I can wait.
I will have to catch you with your guard down. Maybe with sake...
Maybe I should have you write a sonnet.
So we can be even?
Who's counting?
Mmm...
Seems you've got another letter, Hiryū.
Oh! I've been expecting one from the Admiral. Let's see...
What's it say?
It's a fake. See? There's a stroke missing from the top of the first character in his family name.
Morgana?
Morgana.

Fields.MenuText: I thought it was faintly musty...
Who do we think wrote it? Paranoia?
Should we send one back?

Fields.DialogueText: As if it had been locked in a chest aboard a sunken ship.
This is her all over.
No need.
I know exactly what to do with this, Kanchou.
I'm guessing it involves fire.
...You're right. It would be a waste of my guns.
...But that Morgana would not.
Nothing like a firefight to clear the mind, is there?
I find the smoke quite bracing!
@BATTLE
To your stations, everyone! Hiryū, are you daydreaming?
No, Kanchou... I've never been more clearheaded.
@BATTLE
Beautiful night for a drink.
And a poem, remember?
Oh, if you insist.
If she shows her face / She should fear no evil thing / Nor the march of time / For what she looks on unmasked / Trembles with fear or love
My, you certainly know how to flatter a girl.

Fields.MenuText: Least I can do after putting a sword through her.

Fields.DialogueText: You earned that one.

Fields.MenuText: I learned it from her.

Fields.DialogueText: All part of my nefarious plan to spend my days talking to myself.

Fields.MenuText: You really liked it?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't think of me as a teacher. Right now I simply want to be a woman.
It's going to be a long war, isn't it?
They thought the Great War would be over by Christmas.
So if I'm that wrong, then this one should be.
No point dwelling on it. As long as we can live in the moment...I believe the gods will smile on us.
I wouldn't mind living in this moment a little while longer.
You'll share it with me?
I'm the captain. I'm going to share the fate of the ship.
Then let us enjoy the beauty of the moon.
How bright it shines...
Mm... I felt a chill just now.
Allow me.
